All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractColorStrategy
Abstract implementation for the color strategy used by Npc players in game, using the color strategy, the Npc player decide which color choose when drop a card that permit to switch to a new color for the discard pile.
AbstractDropStrategy
Abstract implementation for the drop strategy used by Npc players in game, using the drop strategy the Npc player decide which card drop to discard pile.
AbstractPlayer
The abstract implementation of the player, contains methods valid both for npc and human players.
AbstractTextLabel
Abstract implementation for a text label.
AudioManager
Provide a way to play sound in game, started from code present in UniTelma, implemented using singleton pattern.
Badge
Badge which player can earn playing and winning matches.
BadgeLabel
Badge component for views.
BadgePlayed
Identify a badge assigned to player for played matches.
BadgeWon
Identify a badge assigned to player for won matches.
Card
Abstraction of a Card, Indentify a playing card, this is a void interface used only to tag an object as card.
ChangeOrderOfPlayEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when there is a change of the order of play.
ChoseColorButton
Button used to chose the new color for the discard pile.
ChoseColorButton.ChoseButtonType
The type of the button.
ChoseColorPanel
The panel that hosts buttons used to chose the new color for the discard pile.
Color<T>
Abstraction of a Card Color, implemented as generic to have the possibility to choose the type of the value to represent the color.
ColorDropStrategy
It is the concrete implementation of a drop strategy where the card dropped have the same color of the discard pile.
ColorStrategy
Color strategy used by Npc players in game, using the color strategy, the Npc player decide which color choose when drop a card that permit to switch to a new color for the discard pile.
CurrentPlayerChangeColorEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player change the discard pile color.
CurrentPlayerDrawFourCardEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player have to draw four cards.
CurrentPlayerDrawOneCardAndDropEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player has no card to drop, then draw a card and drop it.
CurrentPlayerDrawOneCardEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player has no card to drop, then draw a card.
CurrentPlayerDrawTwoCardEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player have to draw two cards.
CurrentPlayerDropEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player drop a card.
CurrentPlayerHaveOneCardEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player have only one card.
CurrentPlayerMoveEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player ends the turn, made a move.
CurrentPlayerMoveListener
The action listener used when need to switch to the next player in game, used by the GameController for the recursive timed method call.
CurrentPlayerSkipEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player have skip the turn.
CurrentPlayerWinnerEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player is the winner of the match.
DealCardListener
The action listener used after the game starts to deal cards to players.
DealerLabel
The label to indicate which player is the dealer in a match.
Deck
Abstraction of a deck of cards.
DeckButton
Button for deck, draw a card from deck.
DeckPanel
The panel used to show the deck of Uno cards in game.
DeleteModal
The modal dialog used to confirm a player deletion.
DialogButton
Button for modal dialog.
DialogButton.DialogButtonType
The type of the button.
DiscardPile
Discard pile for the Uno game, a place where to put played cards.
DiscardPileColorLabel
The label to indicate the color of the discard pile.
DiscardPileLabel
The label that shows the card inside the discard pile panel.
DiscardPileListener
The action listener used to add a card to discard pile, actually used only after card deal.
DrawCardListener
Action listener for the draw card player action, actually not used to animate cards inside the game.
DropCardListener
Action listener for the drop card player action, actually not used to animate cards inside the game.
DropStrategy
Drop strategy used by Npc players in game, using the drop strategy the Npc player decide which card drop to discard pile.
EnableChoseColorPanelEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the human player have to choose the discard pile color, the GameView enable the color panel, to choose new color.
EventToHumanCardListener
 
FirstEnableChoseColorPanelEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the current player have to choose the discard pile color when the first card in discard pile is a wild.
FirstHumanPlayerChoseColorEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the human player have to choose the discard pile color when the first card in discard pile is a wild, the GameView enable the color panel, to choose new color.
FirstLoadEvent
Game event used to update view when the application starts.
FontManager
Provide a way to manage custom fonts, implemented using singleton pattern, it is possible to use only a font at time.
GameController
Controls both the GameView and the GameModel of the program, it assigns actions to the GameView components.
GameModel
The model for the game, manage whole match.
GameView
The game table, permit to play uno game.
HumanDropAction
Drop action for human players.
HumanPlayer
The human player in the game, the user.
HumanPlayerChoseColorEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the human player choose the discard pile new color.
HumanPlayerDrawOneCardEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the human player has no card to drop, then draw a card.
HumanPlayerDropEvent
Game event used to update the GameView when the human player drop a card.
InterfaceObserver
My implementation of Observer interface.
Only to avoid the deprecation message :)
JUno
The JUno game, it contains the main method and bootstrap the components of the MVC pattern.
ListPlayers<E>
The list of players in players view.
ListPlayersItem
Item for the list of players.
MainController
Controls the MainView of the program composed by JFrame and set as current view the MenuView.
MainLabel
Label to title a view.
MainView
The main view of the application, provide a way to change the current view, to resize and to go full-screen or to window.
MenuButton
General button used in game views.
MenuController
Controls the MenuView of the program and assign actions to the MenuView components.
MenuView
The main menu of the game, permit to explore all other game sections.
MostColorStrategy
It is the concrete implementation of a color strategy where the color is choose checking the color of all player cards and selecting the color that appears most.
NewPlayerModal
The modal dialog used to insert a new player to the game.
NpcChangeColorAction
Change color action for npc players.
NpcDropAction
Drop action for npc players.
NpcPlayer
The npc player in the game, the AI +/-.
Observable
My implementation of Observable class.
Only to avoid the deprecation message :)
OptionsButtonToggle
Option button for sound and screen, it can be selected or unselected, act like a switch.
OptionsButtonToggle.OptionButtonType
The type of the button.
OptionsController
Controls both the OptionsView and the OptionsModel of the program, it assigns actions to the OptionsView components.
OptionsModel
The model for the options of the game.
OptionsRadioPlayers
Option button to select the number of players.
OptionsRadioPlayers.OptionRadioType
The type of the button.
OptionsView
The options of the game, permit to manage audio, screen and players for the game.
OrderOfPlayLabel
The label that shows the order of play into the game.
Player
Uno card game player.
PlayerAction
A generic action that a player, human or not, can do in game.
PlayerCardButton
The button to represent cards for the human player, provide a way for the human player to interact with owned cards during a match.
PlayerCardLabel
The label to represent cards for the npc players.
PlayerCardLabel.PlayerCardLabelType
The type of the card, where the card will be drawn.
PlayerLabel
Label to title a sub section in a view.
PlayerPanel
The panel that hosts label or buttons used to show cards for the players.
PlayersController
Controls both the PlayersView and the PlayersModel of the program, it assigns actions to the PlayersView components.
PlayersModel
The model for the players of the game, the instance of this class isn't directly serialized to disk like options model, instead are serialized to disk all players profile.
PlayersProfileModel
The model for a single player profile in game.
PlayersView
Players of the game, permit to manage players profiles.
RandomColorStrategy
It is the concrete implementation of a color strategy where the color is choose random.
ResetGameEvent
Game event used to reset game view when there is a change in options.
SaidUnoLabel
The label that shows which player said Uno, implemented action listener.
SectionLabel
Label to title a section in a view.
SerializationManager
Provide a way to save game preferences to disk, implemented using singleton pattern.
StartGameEvent
Game event used to start a match, trigger the card dealing to players.
SubSectionLabel
Label to title a sub section in a view.
Suit<T>
Abstraction of a Card Suit, implemented as generic to have the possibility to choose the type of the value to represent the suit.
TextFieldNewPlayerModal
The text file for new player modal dialog, the place where insert the new player name.
UnoCard
UnoCard, card for the game UNO, this type of card has a value and may have a color
UnoCardComparator
Compare Two cards, used to reorder cards.
UnoColor
The colors in Uno Game, implements the interface Color using a String for the color code.
UnoDeck
Deck of cards for the Uno game.
UnoDeckSimpleFactory
Utility class to generate all cards needed in a Uno game deck.
UnoPlayers
All players in a Uno match.
UnoValue
The values in Uno Game, implements the interface Value using a Integer for the card value.
Value<T>
Abstraction of a Card Value, implemented as generic to have the possibility to choose the type of the value to represent the card value.
ValueDropStrategy
It is the concrete implementation of a drop strategy where the card dropped have the same value of the top card in discard pile.
WithColor<T>
Used to say that a card has a color.
WithOptionalColor
Used to say that a card can have a color, use this for decks where not all cards have a color.
WithSuit<T>
Used to say that a card has a suit, not used for Uno Cards because them doen's have a suit, only value and color.
WithValue<T>
Used to say that a card has a value.
